story:
My Story

Hi!  My name is Hanna Jett King. I'm 23 years old and an artist/ violinist/ writer/ makeup artist/ filmmaker... You get the idea...


I started making leather masks around 6 months ago when I needed to make a prop for a film.  I had a lot of fun making that mask and got a lot of good feedback from it, so I decided to try my hand at making more masks!


I entered my first art exhibit in October, 2010.  I worked very hard to make the 40 pieces required in a very short amount of time.  I had a great time at the show, and once again I got a lot of great feedback and interest in the masks.


My goal is to turn this hobby into a successful business where I can make masks and sell them full time!  I need YOUR help to do this!


Why I Need Your Help

As much as I enjoy making masks, I don't have the money required for materials, website, marketing, etc., to make them full time.  I want to make these masks available for anyone to buy online!


In the meantime, I am working hard to make it happen on my own.  I've been involved in independent films all over NC and SC.  I've also sold quite a few masks through art shows and by word of mouth.  But I need your help!


The Specifics

In order to support making and selling my masks I need funds for:  Leather, an Air Brush and Paint Brushes, Paints, Dyes, Ribbons, Sealers, Face Forms, Leather Tools, and most importantly a larger studio area for me to work!

The process of making these masks is very detailed.  Each mask is one of a kind because I design every one of them individually, cut out the designs, dye them, mold them, paint them, then add the finishing details all by hand!


The money I hope to make here will go directly into helping me find a space to work out of, creating the website where I will be selling my masks, and getting the materials which I need to construct the masks themselves.  Realistically, I will need more than the $1,500 I am trying to raise here to make this goal a reality, but I am using this campaign as the first stepping stone and to get a better feel for peoples interest in my art.


I plan to be posting updates on the progress I make, and the perks will come into effect when I get the website up and running.  After you donate, email me at kingleathermasks@hotmail.com, and I will send you the codeword for which you can claim your discounts and prizes on the website!


Please help me in getting this business going!


How You Can Help

After you donate, share this campaign with your friends and family!  Every little bit will help me get this project off the ground!

story:
QUICK VERSION

 
My name is Eames Demetrios and for the past 9 years I have been going around the world installing bronze plaques and historic sites that honor events from a parallel world.  That parallel universe is called Kcymaerxthaere--and it is the name of the artwork too.  It is like a novel with every page in a different place, and where you read such a page influences how you visualize the story you are reading about.  It sounds a bit unusual, but it is actually a whole lot of fun--for me and the people who follow it, or even those who just stumble upon it.
 
As for being unusual--I think that is what IndieGoGo is for: to connect people with beautiful and unexpected things.   
 
Currently we are at 83 markers and sites in 15 countries so far and a very important installation will be dedicated in Abilene, Texas on April 12.  It is the story of the Museum of the Bench.
 
We want to celebrate with 51 different trading cards of this fictional Museum's collection, to give away (and later sell) as part of the festivities.  In fact, these cards will be a key part of the scavenger hunt we will be doing.
 
Help us out and you will be the proud owner of fine examples of the first edition--and any of our other perks!
 
BACKGROUND
 
I have always enjoyed telling stories, but some time ago, I began to think: wouldn't it be cool if you could visit my stories in our physical world?  I kept imagining how that experience could work---always reflecting just how much language is a part of perception (think how vivid your favorite characters or movies or books are to you).  And then I realized no one was stopping me.  Here is one plaque being installed underwater off the coast of Scotland.
 
 
WHAT IS THE PROJECT ON APRIL 12?
 
Working with a local cultural icon, the Grace Museum, and some amazing local artists, we are doing a significant installation in the small but vibrant Texas city of Abilene.  And we want to celebrate by engaging the community in the parallel world story--that this area was once the home of a vast museum dedicated to benches. 
 
Once a month, linear Abilene has a downtown Artwalk and this April it is going to include a Scavenger Hunt based on this Bench Museum. People will have 2 days to collect the answers. It will be fun.  And then on Saturday we will have the final festivities at the site.
 
I need your help.  We all need your help.  We want people, whether they play the Scavenger Hunt or not, to learn the stories of Kcymaerxthaere.  So we are planning to make many copies of our 51 trading cards of some of the benches to enrich the Scavenger Hunt and to give away around town. 
 
Here are a couple of samples from the set of 51 (the marking on the sides even let you play Chef Ni Zhinn):
 
 
 
THIS STORY
 
For a while now, I have dreamed of the story of the Museum of the Bench, a 430,000 acre facility in and around what we call Abilene dedicated to displaying benches in their natural habitat.  In Kcymaerxthaere, a man named Park Lee Taf would collect benches.  And after he found one he liked, he would make an exact replica to put replace the one he took, and he would bring the original to the Museum where he would build a vast, elaborate and hyperreal diorama in which to display it.  (Here is one of those benches.)
 
I really wanted to make trading cards for such a compelling and mysterious museum.  I also wanted to tell stories on these cards because I love the idea of the reader picking up little fragments of the big story that way.  So I decided to wait a while for those ideas to germinate and for us to have installed more sites around the world.  
 
Meanwhile I bought the least expensive piece of land in Abilene that I could, but land that still had some character. And planned what the location would look like.  Now remember: it is not the whole museum--just a part of it (and just a remnant).
 
About a year ago, I realized we were ready: that I finally knew where in the parallel world the benches in the collection would come from and began to contact some local artists to work on certain aspects of it (come and visit to see).
 
In early April we will begin installation and April 12, 2012 we celebrate with these cards and a scavenger hunt.
 
ARE YOU REINTERPRETING LOCAL HISTORY?
Not really.  To me, local history is fantastic--and Abilene's ("the Future Great City of West Texas") is no different.  No one needs me to dress it up.  What I hope that this project offers is something totally different, but also valuable and affecting: the chance to look at the landscape and the world in general in a completely new way. And that is what Kcymaerxthaere does in place after place, all of which stitch together in the human mind.  Helping people see the things that aren't there.
 
WHO CARES WHAT'S NOT THERE?
People ask me that all the time. All I can say is that for most of us, some of the most important things in our lives are the things that were vivid in our minds but did not exist--though they eventually did: a relationship, a business, our families, a career, whatever.  Experiencing a parallel world viscerally engages that part of ourselves.
 
WHY HELP?
 
The cards are really cool--if you ever had a chance to go to a Museum of Bench, wouldn't you totally want the trading cards?  And get them for a friend?  Now you can!
 It helps Abilene--small, wonderful communities like Abilene are under assault around the world.  So many economic pressures pull on them.  The big cities pull away the next generation, the big outside companies rarely reinvest in the community.  In a small way, a work of art like this whole project can give a shared experience for locals and be a magnet for visitors.  (Check out our Spelling Bee in Paris, Illinois for proof.)
 It supports the project--there is nothing like Kcymaerxthaere, a unique expression of multidimensional storytelling.  If you help us fund this project, we have a whole new product to tell our story to the world with. (because the interlacing stories on the cards will do just that!)
 And the world is a little bit better--Kcymaerxthaere helps people see the world fresh.   Folks who interact with this, encounter one of our installations, often begin to see possibilities.  Help us encourage that!
 
WHAT'S THE MONEY FOR?
 The printing and wrapping of at least 500 complete sets of cards--enough to offer complete sets, wrapped packs of 11, and give away alot of cards for the scavenger hunt.

WHAT HAPPENS IF YOU DON'T RAISE ENOUGH?
 Excellent question.  We have found a digital printer who will print however many trading cards we need at a low cost.  A wonderful designer is doing the design for us already at ultra-low cost, so the primary cost here is the cost of the printing.  This let's us offer this as a perk, even though we are doing flexible funding.
 
WHAT HAPPENS IF YOU RAISE TOO MUCH
We would love to have that problem!  And if we do, the whole Museum of the Bench installation has actually 2 phases of work.  Phase 1 will definitely be done in April, BUT if we get extra money, we can do Phase 1 and 2 at the same time (both involve large scale concrete forms).
 
WE HOPE YOU JOIN US IN KCYMAERXTHAERE!

In early April we will begin installation and April 12, 2012 we celebrate with these cards and a scavenger hunt.
 
ARE YOU REINTERPRETING LOCAL HISTORY?
Not really.  To me, local history is fantastic--and Abilene's ("the Future Great City of West Texas") is no different.  No one needs me to dress it up.  What I hope that this project offers is something totally different, but also valuable and affecting: the chance to look at the landscape and the world in general in a completely new way. And that is what Kcymaerxthaere does in place after place, all of which stitch together in the human mind.  Helping people see the things that aren't there.
 
WHO CARES WHAT'S NOT THERE?
People ask me that all the time. All I can say is that for most of us, some of the most important things in our lives are the things that were vivid in our minds but did not exist--though they eventually did: a relationship, a business, our families, a career, whatever.  Experiencing a parallel world viscerally engages that part of ourselves.
 
WHY HELP?
 

The cards are really cool--if you ever had a chance to go to a Museum of Bench, wouldn't you totally want the trading cards?  And get them for a friend?  Now you can!
 It helps Abilene--small, wonderful communities like Abilene are under assault around the world.  So many economic pressures pull on them.  The big cities pull away the next generation, the big outside companies rarely reinvest in the community.  In a small way, a work of art like this whole project can give a shared experience for locals and be a magnet for visitors.  (Check out our Spelling Bee in Paris, Illinois for proof.)
 It supports the project--there is nothing like Kcymaerxthaere, a unique expression of multidimensional storytelling.  If you help us fund this project, we have a whole new product to tell our story to the world with. (because the interlacing stories on the cards will do just that!)
 And the world is a little bit better--Kcymaerxthaere helps people see the world fresh.   Folks who interact with this, encounter one of our installations, often begin to see possibilities.  Help us encourage that!
 
WHAT'S THE MONEY FOR?
 The printing and wrapping of at least 500 complete sets of cards--enough to offer complete sets, wrapped packs of 11, and give away alot of cards for the scavenger hunt.

WHAT HAPPENS IF YOU DON'T RAISE ENOUGH?

 Excellent question.  We have found a digital printer who will print however many trading cards we need at a low cost.  A wonderful designer is doing the design for us already at ultra-low cost, so the primary cost here is the cost of the printing.  This let's us offer this as a perk, even though we are doing flexible funding.
 
WHAT HAPPENS IF YOU RAISE TOO MUCH

We would love to have that problem!  And if we do, the whole Museum of the Bench installation has actually 2 phases of work.  Phase 1 will definitely be done in April, BUT if we get extra money, we can do Phase 1 and 2 at the same time (both involve large scale concrete forms).
 
WE HOPE YOU JOIN US IN KCYMAERXTHAERE!

story:
What's the story with the Art Monastery?

The Art Monastery Project is dedicated to cultivating personal awakening and cultural transformation through art, contemplation, and community. The Art Monastery supports artists and produces cultural events both in the U.S. and at our pilot site in Italy.

What's special about the Art Monastery is pairing the monastic process with a really amazing art product. We strive to value the artist as a whole person as much as the art we create, and to make stunning, world-changing art through an inclusive, sacred process that blends traditional monasticism with a fresh, contemporary perspective.

A bit of Art Monastery history

This is the fifth year of the Art Monastery Project and we're so proud of all we've accomplished. We've produced dozens of concerts and events in the U.S., in addition to our annual silent meditation retreats that take place in California every winter. Also, we've established both short-term and long-term residency programs in Italy that have produced everything from Gregorian Chant concerts and other early music to deconstructed tap dance and site-specific visual art installations.

What's special about this year?

This year, we want to take it one step further and create something really special. This summer we're bringing nine American artists together in Italy for a full 90 days. It's our longest residency program yet, and the idea is to create a really intensive laboratory that will fuel innovative and meaningful art-making. We've chosen artists from all over the U.S. from various disciplines: Neva Cockrell, Anaya Cullen, Ryan Hazelbaker, Andi Hemmenway, and Raphael Sacks, to join our core team: Betsy McCall, Charles Darius, Molly Freedenberg, and me! On June 1 we’ll all gather here in the beautiful Italian countryside to devise one collaborative, multi-disciplinary theater piece. We'll spend the first six weeks in a monastic development period that will include nightly Gregorian Chant, shared meals and chores, and a rigorous communal schedule. The final six weeks, we will tour the work to Italian festivals, aspiring to change the lives of the people who experience the show.

How will the AMP use the money?

Your money goes to a lot of really awesome, practical, useful things that will make this summer’s programming possible! For example: an electric guitar, a video projector, costumes and fabric, power cords and converters, fixing the broken keys on our piano, just to name a few. One of the guiding principles at the Art Monastery is Resourcefulness, so it’s one of our highest priorities to make sure that your money goes a long way.

The world we can create together

We believe that making art through an intentional, contemplative, and collaborative process in this economic/political climate sends a powerful message - we are actively creating the world we want to see.

This is not about bureaucratic art making to please and entertain the masses. At the heart of it, this process and the art it creates is for people who want to see real change and beauty in the world, and so we hope it will be funded by those same people. We hope that you'll take your $10, $25, or whatever amount feels really good to you, and use that money to stand with us in the name of art. At the Art Monastery, we believe that getting a group of artists together in a focused setting, in the spirit of a monastic community - an Otherhood - we believe that this is a radical act. We believe that this radical act is WORTH something in the world, that the creation of art is powerful and important, that the value of contemplation can't be measured, and that the creation of meaning is the most valuable thing of all.

We believe that great art and great monks really can change the world.

We hope you'll join us.

Thank you.

story:
NOTICE TO ALL WHO DONATE!

It seems that the perks that your supposed to receive are not accurately reflected with your donation. Don't worry, I see all the details, and I'll be sure to get you what you earn!  Thank you so much!!

ALSO, In order for me to send you your fabulous prizes, I'm going to need some contact information. Please leave some contact information when you donate! :)

_____________________________________________________________________________

Our Story

Hi there!  I'm Nate Courteau and I've been an independent special effects artist and sculptor since the early 90's and if there's one thing that I've learned in all my years, it's that Zombies make the world go 'round!


I first designed the Bobble Dead back in 2006. I wanted to create a fun product that had instant appeal and a proven background. Well, Bobbleheads have been around since ancient China, and Zombies are not only back en vogue, but hotter than ever! So, after talking to various toy companies, I decided to launch the first wave independently, gauge the response and possibly sell the property to a manufacturer. But to do this, I need to fund a small run of each Bobble Dead, around 250 copies of each and that's where YOU come in! YAY!


The Impact

Bobble Dead are part of a larger business model conceived by Nate Courteau and his business, n8-fx. Formerly Courteau Sculpture Studio, n8-fx supplies special makeup effects, props and sculpture to various industries and the ultimate goal is to help grow and sustain the local arts community through viable and ethical business practices.  




What We Need & What You Get

 I currently have three completed Bobble Dead prototype dolls, I'd love to have all three manufactured for sale, and it's costs roughly $3000.00 each for a run of 250.  

If this campaign is successful and indeed surpasses the initial goal, all of the additional money will go to production of the first three Bobble Dead dolls as well as improve and expand the Bobble Dead line, develop its web identity and promotions.  If the initial goal is not reached with this campaign, the existing money will go into the production of the first one or two Bobble Dead dolls; and the proceeds from these will go into further production. 

Other Ways You Can Help

YOU can help spread the love and warming, warming love that only a bobbling zombie can! Please spread the word via any medium you can think of; Internets, telephone, (cell or land line), rumor, underground magazine, cup-and-string, message in a bottle, confession, (provided the priest is unethical) careless whispers and ETC! 


But with all sincerity, I'm hoping that you could be a part of the successful, domestic, and ethical business I've always wanted to realize. Any help would be so very appreciated. Thank you!!


I need to thank

Kevin Horn. http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1280610138  For his invaluable help in this campaign!

Cynthia Uhrich.  http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=653203671  So talented. So generous!

Aaron Courteau.  http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=740426832  You're sooo... good lookin'!

Nicole Kruex.  http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100000632678525  You inspire me!

Mitchel A. Jones.  http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=619055564  For including me and my baby in your project!

Josh Courteau.  http://www.facebook.com/ipsophatso  You've been a rock and a supporter like no one else.  I'm lucky to have you, bro.

Elias Sanchez.  http://www.facebook.com/unicyclist47  Thank you so much for your generosity and professionalism!

Nial Nelson Hopkins. http://www.facebook.com/NialFilm  Thank you for helping out some total stranger! I'm humbled by you and the rest of the new folks on the scene.:)

story:
The Happy Hollow Artist's Retreat is about creating space for artists with day jobs to be refreshed as well as to find the time to create in a beautiful and peaceful environment on Whidbey Island, north of Seattle.

Ideally, the location will include:

An area surrounded by wildlife, beauty, and quiet

A cabin with full living accommodations

A 1,000 sq.ft. fully equipped studio space for visiting artists

An atmosphere which fosters creative dialogue and development

A space for the caretakers of this retreat to provide group meals and meeting space

A few yurts with basic amenities for more adventurous artists to come and stay in.

A place for our local community to come learn from visiting artists and vice versa.

Not only are you making a retreat center, you are hiring us as retreat directors. Who are we?  Chris and Joy Dennis.  We met in art school.  We own and operate the Island Framery, a local custom art framing shop on Whidbey Island. Check it out at www.islandframery.com. Our passions are family, art, compassionate living, mentoring new artists, nurturing the creative spirit and happiness! We have dreamed for years about having a space to host artists in a retreat type setting. Creative occupations are a financially difficult, but fulfilling life path. Our desire is to support and encourage people who have made this choice.  

Our goal is to have this be a cash free service where artists are recommended and selected by you, our backers.  They will commit to donating a completed work as payment for their time spent at the retreat. In the beginning stage of this project, the donated work be made available to our backers before the public as gifts for their support. Art will be accessible via an online catalog where you may choose work that is the same value as your pledge.  Who gets what art? Pledge early, choose early; pledge later, choose later. When the commitment to our Indiegogo backers is completed, the art will continue be sold online and via a local gallery, with the profits being used to keep our program going.  

We are located on Whidbey Island, close to Seattle, but far enough away that you can't help but leave the cares of the mainland behind when you visit.  Whidbey Island is filled with wildlife, beaches, trees, and miles of hiking trails.  There is a lot of elbow room here, and if you do happen to bump into somebody on this island, it's probably because it's a person that you should meet--seriously, this is a place of constant serendipity and discovery.

We have the perfect property for this project in mind, but time is of the essence.  Our minimum to get started requires 111,000, however 250,000 will get the project fully underway within a couple of months.

story:
Artist's Statement:

Trees are an indicator of the health of our planet.  Likewise, trees represent the capacity of our planet to sustain us.  Balancing on one leg and reaching as far as possible to the sky is one way to emulate trees; yoga in and of itself is a way to calm our minds so that the fresh air, shade, reflected light and all that is out there permeating the world outside of us can be experienced within ourselves.  In thinking about powerful symbols that embody environmental stewardship, I found myself reflecting on Hatha Yoga’s tree pose.  

I created "Tree Pose" as a monument to people who listen to and care about nature.  I like to imagine an archeologist hundreds of years in the future digging through our rubble and discovering this piece.  Just as we unearthed tombs and pyramids and wonder why they were built; the future archeologist will come across this large sculpture of a person posing like a tree and question the intent behind its creation.  I wonder what theories they will invent to explain a monument of a person standing on one leg?        

I am excited to have been asked by the city of Solana Beach to display "Tree Pose" on the corner of Highland Drive and Sun Valley Road. It is a busy intersection where lots of people will see it.   I made "Tree Pose" originally for the port of San Diego to be displayed in their Urban Trees 7 exhibit.  It was on display in front of the cruise ship terminal on Harbor Drive for one year. When that ended I asked Solana Beach if they had a place for it.  I knew that Solan Beach has a public art program.  I think of Solana beach  as a good place for this sculpture because that area seems like a place where a lot of people practice yoga.   Several months passed without a reply. I donated it to McKinley elementary school in North Park.  They have been very excited to have it and put a lot of effort and funds into makeing a nice base for it.  They just  installing it at their front entrance this week!

Solana Beach asked me for the sculpture just as the school was pooring footings to anchore the sculpture.   Solana Beach only has $500 which is intended to cover the cost of transporting an already existing sculpture.  This is why I am reaching out to all of you for help.  Let's a new Tree Pose Sculpture.   The new one will be a slightly different expression of the same idea.  The main difference will be the surface and color.   With more funds I can make it bigger and better.  With less funds I will make it smaller.  With your help it will be big enough to look like a true monument.

Some of the funding will go towards materials, some will go towards transportation of such a large sculpture, and some of it will help me support my family while I work on it. I also hope to use more expencive materials this time.   It won’t take more than 2 weeks to build.  I already made the one for the port of San Diego for $2000 and only went a little over budget in time spent on it and transportation.  So I am familiar with what I am up against.  I have made other large sculptures for Palomar College Arboretum and for many residences.  

Your contribution, large or small, will make a huge difference.  Check out the fun gifts you get when you contribute. Make some noise to your friends and use the indigogoshare tools for your social media.  

A Huge Thank You,

Brennan Hubbell

story:
What is Beautiful People?

Beautiful People is a photographic book with stories, in which i want to help overcome stereotypical portraiture of the lives of people in Roma communities. To me Roma are beautiful and proud people, whose culture and identity have been almost systematically destroyed by several regimes in the recent history of Central Europe.

The people in my photographs live in the worst possible conditions just outside of the town Kezmarok, in Velka Lomnica, Slovakia. 2.000 people live without water supplies and canalization. But despite the slum-like conditions, their houses are always clean and tidy. And every one has at least one set of nice clothes for special occasions. When I portrayed them, i asked them to show themselves in the way that they want to be seen.

These photographs show men and women who try to live a better life. Men and women who show us that change is possible.  

 

A unique book about overcoming stereotypes

The book Beautiful People will be an important resource of how to approach a broad and foreign audience. It will include photographs with short texts, connected to the portrayed person, as well as texts focused on more complex comprehension of Roma issues. It will become a prestigious, however an open publication for the reader, with the potential to address different social groups, generations and readers from various countries.

With this book i hope to reach those who are in power to make a change: politicians who can influence social changes, the Roma people themselves, with the hope that this project will boost their self confidence. And on a new generation, who’s opinion matters.

The publication is being prepared with several different experts. The authors of the texts will be influential personas who will contribute to the value of the content of the book.

Your contributions will be used for text editing and translations (it will be in three languages - English, Roma and Slovak), book design, printing costs (size 24x28cm,130 pages) and distribution. I plan to publish the book in September 2013.

Your contribution will be rewarded by postcards, a signed book or original photographs. And the good feeling that your have helped to overcome prejudices that live in our society. In return I will donate 10% of the sale of the book to „Dive Maky“, a Slovak n.g.o. that adopts talented Roma children and helps them with their education and carreer.

Help me to spread a word about my campaign Beautiful People. Thank you!

Šymon Kliman

These photographs show men and women who try to live a better life. Men and women who show us that change is possible.  
 
A unique book about overcoming stereotypes
The book Beautiful People will be an important resource of how to approach a broad and foreign audience. It will include photographs with short texts, connected to the portrayed person, as well as texts focused on more complex comprehension of Roma issues. It will become a prestigious, however an open publication for the reader, with the potential to address different social groups, generations and readers from various countries.
With this book i hope to reach those who are in power to make a change: politicians who can influence social changes, the Roma people themselves, with the hope that this project will boost their self confidence. And on a new generation, who’s opinion matters.
The publication is being prepared with several different experts. The authors of the texts will be influential personas who will contribute to the value of the content of the book.
Your contributions will be used for text editing and translations (it will be in three languages - English, Roma and Slovak), book design, printing costs (size 24x28cm,130 pages) and distribution. I plan to publish the book in September 2013.
Your contribution will be rewarded by postcards, a signed book or original photographs. And the good feeling that your have helped to overcome prejudices that live in our society. In return I will donate 10% of the sale of the book to „Dive Maky“, a Slovak n.g.o. that adopts talented Roma children and helps them with their education and carreer.
Help me to spread a word about my campaign Beautiful People. Thank you!
Šymon Kliman

story:
Short Summary

In June and July, 2014, I will be an artist in residence at SIM residency in Reykjavik, Iceland. While there I will have access to a living space and a studio and will be able to explore new installation and large scale drawing ideas. Over the course of two months I plan to make and document a series of new installations that deal with multiples and miniatures, generate a new series of drawings that deal with landscape, line work and texture, and take in the art scene of Iceland. I will also take a few trips around the country on several of the weekends to collect images, sketches, and experiences for my work. And I have wanted to go to Iceland since I was a kid so I will, in general, be elated and camera happy the whole time I'm there.

For the month of August I am planning to back pack around Europe and eastern Europe. I have not planned the itinerary as yet, though it will include several cities where I know artists and where I plan to collaborate/experiment. As well, I see this time in between as a way to absorb more fuel for making and to process the work I made while in Iceland.  The cities on the list to be narrowed down, no doubt, are Glasgow, London, Berlin, Budapest, Vienna, Toulon, Barcelona.

For the months of September and October I will be at another residency called DRAWInternational in Caylus, France, where I will be working with a group of artists on the question "what is drawing?" This residency will allow for both group exploration and solo studio time and it's emphasis is on drawing - in particular, the experimentation of drawing and it's possibilities.  During this time I will be considering the body and its full range of movement as a drawing tool/implement and will be taking another look at generating graphic scores for dancers and performances to be staged upon my return to the States.

What We Need & What You Get

Estimated costs after pricing things out as of January 2014:

flight to iceland - 420
buses to several places in the country of iceland to research and sketch - 300
flight to london - 165
flight to berlin - 130
european rail pass - 600
residency fees - 2000
meals for 5 months - 1000
phone for 5 months - 400
travel insurance - est. 450
flight home - 800
art materials for 4 months of residencies - 500
costs to ship work to the usa - 600
room costs for august - 200
emergency/extra - 435
total - 8000


The Impact

I have been to a few residencies in the past and they are always enlightening, challenging, expanding, and what in the end generates a major step forward with my work and my career goals. They have also often included new collaborations with fellow artists that have helped everyone involved to move through new questions in their work and have feedback in and around their process. I am excited to take this experience abroad this coming summer and to spend some time traveling alone, finding a new level to my voice and artistic practice and pushing myself outside of my comfort zone in order to expand.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Some things I could use if you can't back me financially and are willing to sponsor me with an item: a small / medium hikers backpack, an international outlet adaptor, a used tablet or ipad
  • I will be couchsurfing during the month of august and am looking for hosts or tips for things to check out in the cities listed above
  • or Use the Indiegogo share buttons or forward this campaign and help me spread the word! Thank you Thank you Thank you!

story:
above image © Polina Terleeva 2013



Who's Vanessa, yo?

I'm a recent photography graduate, and am currently obtaining my BFA in Art History & Film Studies at Concordia University.

I am a second generation Italian immigrant, whose family originates from a small town in the southern Italian countryside. Over the past few years, I have been strongly interested in the culture that has developed in North America: the traditions that have remained, and those that have taken on the influence of North America, Canada, and specifically Quebec's own traditions and beliefs. I have also grown extremely interested in learning specifically about the dialects and traditions that have remained in these small towns throughout Romance language countries in Europe, decades after the waves of immigrants left these places.

images of my final portfolio critique at Dawson College, May 2013. © Claudio Calligaris 2013 


What is the purpose of Vanessa's campaign?
I recently was accepted to participate as an international artist-in-residence at Linea de Costa, a program based in Cadiz, Spain. In the two months prior to my residency, I will be travelling along Italy, France, Spain & Portugal, recording the regional dialects and photographing the individuals in towns that are quickly disappearing in favour of large cities. I will then attend the residency program, where I will gather the photos and information and self-publish a small photo book on these towns.
My project aims to serve as a visual anthropological project, where I document and record these small towns whose stories risk extinction. This project will also be, finally, a return to my own heritage, one that I have attempted to cling to and immortalize here in Canada as well, through my "Un ricordo" series.

my photographs hung at Dawson College Professional Photography graduating vernissage, May 2013.

What will donations do?
They will help in funding my one-month long residency in Cadiz, Spain.
They will help in funding my travels to coastal towns along the Mediterranean and into these small towns and communities.
They will help in funding necessary materials to photograph, record, and document, as well as to compile and successfully self-publish my photo book.
They will help in bringing necessary awareness to these small communities and for heritage that is vital in archiving, remembering, and continuing to keep alive.

in front of Linea de Costa Residency (IKR?!), image courtesy Linea de Costa Facebook page.

Can you break it down for me, sister?
Yes, absolutely! You'll be helping me pay for:

-travel/airfare
-residency fee
-living expenses
-artist & production material
-room/board while travelling

What can I receive from my donations?
I am offering a variety of perks:
- 25.00$: a postcard sent to you while on my travels and attending my residency
- 50.00$: (9 available) a signed 4"x6" print
- 100.00$: (6 available) a signed 8"x10" print
- 150.00$: (6 available) a signed 8"x10" print and credit in the acknowledgments section of book
- 250.00$: (3 available) a signed copy of my photo book and credit in the acknowledgements section
choose a print from my web site

rough map of travel route, ending in Cadiz. locations are estimations - I will actually be travelling in small towns in those areas/provinces.

Why donate?
Well, simply said: this is a project that is much bigger than me. It is bigger than my own personal heritage, and that of my family. It is the story of so many small communities that so many immigrants may feel personal ties and dedication to. This project aims to raise awareness not only for the communities found in these countries which I have my own ties to, but to the importance and value in recording and keeping cultures alive in a world where globalization unfortunately destructs many traditions, dialects, languages, and communities. It is an important heritage, art, and anthropology project to be a part of.
Moreover, it is allowing me the opportunity to explore my own personal heritage, and to create that which I love most from it. Over the last few years, I have focused much of my work on the importance of community, culture, and tradition through my own photo/video work, and am ready to continue this project on a much larger scale.
And finally, it will permit me to connect and network with international artists and international communities, while working in an uninhibited and open environment over the course of my residency.

I don't think I can donate very much, or at all. How else can I help?
You can share this page with your friends, family, community/arts centres, and anyone you think would want to see it. Spreading the word (especially through social networks) helps a lot, too!
If you come from one of the countries that I'll be visiting, or have family and friends that you can put me into contact with, this would be more than appreciated.

my nonno (grandfather) near Rome, Italy, ca. 1958

Montelongo, Italy (artist's family's town of origin), image courtesy Google Street View.

story:
I recently moved to Atlanta to pursue my dreams to become a tattoo artist, and I have reached the first step to achieving my goal!

Anyone can easily surf the web for just a couple of minutes and find all kinds of articles and FAQs about a tattoo apprenticeship and see that they are 

1.Time consuming

2. Very critical of work ethic

3. Difficult to get an apprenticeship to begin with

I will be working 6 days a week and a minimum of 12 hours a day with no pay! Basically having to prove myself to the shop and other artists that I am indeed worth their time and I have what it takes to pursue this career. I have saved up as much money as I can but I still need help for purchases for the equipment and art supplies to start tattooing

Broken down basic costs based on all the start off supplies needed.

-Tattoo machines(Liner and a Shader)  $100-$200

-Power supply for the tattoo machine $60

-Needles and tubes $100

-Tattoo ink, etc. $150

-Sterilization supplies $100

-Art supplies $150

-Reference books $50

General shipping cost has been included for my goal.

Perks I will be offering for certain donation amounts will be ranging from small original acrylic paintings on un-stretched canvas to much bigger elaborate paintings or prisma color work depending on the preference of the donator. 

Thank you so much for looking

story:
What is DOCNOW?

DOCNOW is a free multimedia arts festival now in its fifth year, exhibiting the important work of graduating students from Ryerson University’s Master of Fine Arts program in Documentary Media. In keeping with the tradition of Ryerson’s program of pushing the boundaries of documentary practice, DOCNOW appeals to a diverse and expansive audience exploring a range of subjects from issues surrounding immigration and identity to social justice, and storytelling.

The program, established in 2007 and the only one of its kind in Canada, is dedicated to the development of tomorrow’s documentary filmmakers, visual artists, and photographers. Through the production of critically engaged visual narratives, the participating artists of DOCNOW contribute to the evolving field of documentary practice whilst illuminating the world-renowned reputation of Canadian documentary makers.

Tell Me More... 

With great excitement and anticipation we are planning to make DOCNOW 2013 the best yet. This year’s festival will take place from May 28 – June 30 at several high profile venues in Toronto, including two nights of film screenings at Bloor Hot Docs Cinema and exhibitions at Toronto Image Works, Oz Studios, Gladstone Art Bar, the IMA Gallery, and the Ryerson Image Center. These outlets will help to increase the visibility of the important issues addressed in the films, photography and new media installations. 

As a student run, non-profit arts festival, the majority of our budget comes from the funds that we are able to raise ourselves. All of the money raised in this campaign, whether we reach our goal or not will go directly towards expenses such as venue costs and promotional materials – both of which are vital to the successful operation of DOCNOW 2013. Any funds left over after this year’s festival will be used for next year’s, so no matter what your contribution is essential.

Although Toronto has a rich tradition of expression in the documentary arts, with festivals like Hot Docs and CONTACT, DOCNOW offers the unique perspective of being a free, mixed-media festival. Far from being a simple student festival, DOCNOW features artists, both emerging and established, from a diverse range of cultural and artistic backgrounds. As such, DOCNOW is becoming a vital part of Toronto's artistic community, however we cannot successfully build the profile and visibility of the festival without the support of our generous donors.

Contributing to DOCNOW 2013 will not only help this festival to exist, but will allow us to reach out into the community at large to spread important new ideas.

Other ways to help

If you can't help financially, please help us out by showing up to the festival, and spreading the word.

If you would like to sponsor this event, or make in-kind donations, please contact sponsorship@docnow.ca

story:
Hi! ALEGRIA: Hope through Art inspires and empowers the most underserved youth and their communities to achieve their potential and transform their lives through the arts. What began as a grassroots effort of communities has grown into a movement invested in seeing the trajectory of youth's lives changed. Hogar de la Sagrada Familia is a haven for abandoned children living in the outskirts of Lima, Peru. ALEGRIA supports La Sagrada Familia through arts education and sustainable resources that allow the children to thrive. We are currently creating capacity to support additional youth in need, and strengthening ALEGRIA as a partner of these communities. This coming year, ALEGRIA plans to partner with NYC nonprofit organizations to provide intensive summer visual arts, slam poetry, hip-hop, fashion and photography programming for 50 youth in need. 

 

What We Need

$10,000 will provide 8 weeks of intensive summer visual arts, slam poetry, hip-hop, fashion and photography programming for 50 NYC youth who deserve the chance to artistically express themselves! These kids have endured tough situations at home and will benefit from creatively exploring the world around them.

To break it down:

$5,000 will go toward supplies and field trip costs- paper, pencils, charcoal, paints, markers, ink, glue, brushes, fabric, thread, sewing machines, cameras, space rentals, and transportation and entrance fees for the kids to attend unique creative performances and experiences.

$2,000 will go toward sustainability- extra supplies, lesson plans for a continuation of programming, future hours dedicated to ensure that the kids have the opportunity to further their interest in creative arts.

$1,500 will go toward program planning and administration- 80+ hours of planning will be dedicated to ensure that these kids receive the best supplies, attention and guidance possible.

$1,500 will go toward stipends- teachers will dedicate two-weeks of their time sharing their visual art, poetry, hip-hop, fashion and photography craft with the kids.

When we say intensive- we mean hands on, one-on-one attention for kids who will greatly benefit from creative outlets.

ALEGRIA: Hope through Art is a 501(c)3 charity and your donations are tax-exempt to the extent of the law. You will receive a tax-deductible receipt for your contribution.

 

The Impact

Art is universal. Hopelessness is universal. New York City is home to many of the world's most renowned artists and creative experiences, yet we also have so many youth who face tremendous odds. We are so excited to inspire and empower underserved youth in NYC through artistic opportunities and arts education resources they would have never otherwise experienced.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to make a contribution today, share, share, SHARE. Use the Indiegogo share tools to send our campaign to friends and family who may be inspired to give today. If you are an artist, and would like to talk more about joining the ALEGRIA team, please contact us. ALEGRIA means joy. We find joy in sharing and building community, and we hope you will too.

story:
Who Am I?

I was born and raised in Banff National Park. Growing up I took courses at the Banff School of Fine Arts and spend many hours with my family in the mountains hiking and fishing (I was painting). After high school graduation I attended the Kootenay School of Art in Nelson B.C. Then I got married and had 3 beautiful girls. Later, I found myself supporting my children alone. I went back to school twice, once doing equine studies and working with racehorses and then to study computer science. I worked as a computer professional with the government for 20 years while raising my girls. Through those years I drew and painted whenever I could find the time. I retired as soon as I had enough of a pension to support myself. I knew I would not have much money to live on but I wanted to try being a full time artist before I got too old. Now I have this wonderful opportunity to paint in the Arctic as well as on the north shores of Lake Superior but I need your help to be able to do it.

 

What is this Campaign all about?

I was looking for a way to travel to Canada’s Parks to paint when I learned about Parks Canada Artist in Residence programs so I applied to a few. I am thrilled to say my efforts were rewarded with not one Artist in Residence program but two!

The one I am most excited about is called “Art in the Park at Ivvavik National Park”. It takes place in June 2012. Ivvavik National Park is in the top Northwestern Corner of the Yukon. It borders on Alaska on the Western side and the Beaufort Sea (Arctic Ocean) on the northern side. Out of the many artists that applied only 3 were chosen from the list of applicants and 3 more participants that are beneficiaries of the Inuvialuit land claim. So Northern and Southern Canadian painters will be living and painting together. We will be flown from Inuvik to Ivvavik to live in tents and paint together for 2 weeks in June. The bugs are ‘best” then apparently and the caribou are migrating through the park along with their predators, wolves and grizzly bears. 3 Parks Canada employees will be along as our guides and protectors. I am sure the exchange of ideas will be very illuminating! Oh Yes! There will be 24 hours of sunlight so we can paint all night too!

 

The second Project  is called “Artist-In-Residence Pukaskwa National Park”. It takes place the last week of August 2012.  Pukaskwa National Park is located in Ontario on the Northeast shores of Lake Superior on Heron Bay. I will live in the campgrounds at the park and give 2, 2 hour workshops for visitors to the park. I will give a workshop on “Creating a Travel Sketchbook” and one on “Plein Air Watercolors”. I will be painting in the park and my work will be on display in the Information Center.

 

 What do I need and what will you get in return?

For Project #1 Art in the Park at Ivvavil National Park

Parks Canada covers all expenses for the Ivvavik Project once I get to Inuvik Northwest Territories. Getting that far is the expensive part. Parks Canada will reimburse me up to $500.00 for travel to Inuvik. The problem is the return flight to Inuvik from Edmonton is over $2000.00. And I have to get to Edmonton. I will stay in Alberta and visit relatives and they will pay my way back to Ottawa. I have applied for grants with the Canada Council for the Arts but discovered their grants do not cover a project put on by another government department. I tried to apply for a travel grant from the Ontario Arts Council but they only cover travel between Ontario and Quebec. They do have an exhibition grant that I expect to be applying for in the fall.

 

Here is a list of expenses I need to cover.

One way to Edmonton                                                               255.00

2 nights in a hotel in Edmonton (one night each way)              176.00

Return from Edmonton to Inuvik                                             1952.00

Sub Total Travel                                                     2383.00

Art Supplies

  Watercolor Blocks (paper) Arches 9 * 12                                 43.00

Total                                                                                         2426.00

Minus a gift from a dear friend who has already contributed 1600.00!

Total I still need for this trip                                                      826.00

 

For Project #2 Artist-in-Residence  Pukaskwa National Park

 

For the second project I will need to drive my car to Pukaskwa National Park and then I will be given a campsite once I get there. (Both projects involve camping). I need gas and hotel money for this project.

Gas for my car (Pt Cruiser traveling  981 kms each way)

For a total of 1962 kms. Since I get around 10km per liter (although sometimes less)

 196.2 liters @ 1.25 (hope the price stays stable)  =  245.25 for gas so lets round that up to                                     250.00

13 hours 19 mins  - this is too far for me to drive in one day.

Two nights in a hotel each way                                     200.00

So this project will cost me approximately                     450.00

Total needed for both trips                                              1276.00

What will you get in return?

  • $10.00 – a post card with an image from one of the National Parks in the   project signed by the artist and a big thank you
  • $25.00 -  6"x6" original sketch created in Ivvavick National Park signed by the artist
  • $50.00 -  6"x6" original sketches, one created in Ivvavik National Park and one created in Pukaskwa National Park, each signed by the artist.
  • $75.00 – Your choice of a 7” * 10” original watercolour painting done in either National Park
  • $100.00 – A photocopy of the watercolour journal that I will create while in the Arctic ( Ivvavik National Park)

If it should happen that I do not achieve the full amount of the campaign, I have already purchased my tickets to Inuvik on borrowed money so I would still go to Ivavik National Park and not be able to repay the loan. I would have to consider canceling my trip to Pukaskwa.

The Impact

  Parks Canada believes that work produced and exhibited by artists visiting and painting in the park will reach a much broader urban audience than other outreach efforts. Each artist is required to donate one of their paintings created at Ivvavik National Park to Parks Canada to use in their promotions.

 I have told Parks Canada that I will exhibit work done in the Park in Ottawa, Quebec and perhaps in other provinces in order for Canadians to develop a stronger sense of connection to the park. I did not know about this park before I applied for this project!  I believe I will be inspired by these remote wilderness areas and by the communication with the others artists. I believe it is so important to preserve these areas. Your contributions will make this all possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE

Let everyone know, please pass it along – Thank you!

Spread the Word!

Thank you, thank you!

I wish to thank all my friends that have already contributed by lending me such things a tent, sleeping bag, mattress, down vests, quick dry towels, bug jacket, mosquito hat and pack sacks.
story_txt:
Who Am I?
I was born and raised in Banff National Park. Growing up I took courses at the Banff School of Fine Arts and spend many hours with my family in the mountains hiking and fishing (I was painting). After high school graduation I attended the Kootenay School of Art in Nelson B.C. Then I got married and had 3 beautiful girls. Later, I found myself supporting my children alone. I went back to school twice, once doing equine studies and working with racehorses and then to study computer science. I worked as a computer professional with the government for 20 years while raising my girls. Through those years I drew and painted whenever I could find the time. I retired as soon as I had enough of a pension to support myself. I knew I would not have much money to live on but I wanted to try being a full time artist before I got too old. Now I have this wonderful opportunity to paint in the Arctic as well as on the north shores of Lake Superior but I need your help to be able to do it.
 


What is this Campaign all about?
I was looking for a way to travel to Canada’s Parks to paint when I learned about Parks Canada Artist in Residence programs so I applied to a few. I am thrilled to say my efforts were rewarded with not one Artist in Residence program but two!
The one I am most excited about is called “Art in the Park at Ivvavik National Park”. It takes place in June 2012. Ivvavik National Park is in the top Northwestern Corner of the Yukon. It borders on Alaska on the Western side and the Beaufort Sea (Arctic Ocean) on the northern side. Out of the many artists that applied only 3 were chosen from the list of applicants and 3 more participants that are beneficiaries of the Inuvialuit land claim. So Northern and Southern Canadian painters will be living and painting together. We will be flown from Inuvik to Ivvavik to live in tents and paint together for 2 weeks in June. The bugs are ‘best” then apparently and the caribou are migrating through the park along with their predators, wolves and grizzly bears. 3 Parks Canada employees will be along as our guides and protectors. I am sure the exchange of ideas will be very illuminating! Oh Yes! There will be 24 hours of sunlight so we can paint all night too!

Total I still need for this trip                                                      826.00

story:
For over 20 years I’ve been putting words together because I love to write. I fell in love with poetry when I was in High School. I love the art. It was my hobby, something I found more entertaining than anything in this world. In 2005 when my dad drowned due to staying in New Orleans for hurricane Katrina, poetry became my therapy. Before Katrina I hadn’t performed spoken word much. Just at school mostly. It wasn’t until I moved back to New Orleans that I started hitting the stage and performing in front of people. In 2008 I put out my first book “I Write To…” That’s when I started to move towards a more professional mind frame concerning poetry. But I still was in school for nursing, still maintaining my day job as a front end Supervisor at Whole Foods Market. Fast forward to 2013, I successfully started my own company SWMN Publishing, I published 7 books, 6 books are my books, One of my books is currently being sold in a Whole Foods Market, I’ve recorded 3 spoken word albums, my words have reached countries all over the world, I’m Write NOLA Festivals 2012 Writer of the Year, I’m one of the faces of spoken word in New Orleans, I’ve successfully organized or helped organize many spoken word events in my city, and I’m currently traveling the United States.  Days after being fired from Whole Foods Market where I was employed for 10 yrs of my life, I’m sitting here reflecting on my journey thus far. I’ve wanted to quit my job at Whole Foods for some time now. But I wanted to quit when I felt I was financially ready. Honestly I’m not sure if I ever would have quit because I was too comfortable. The Money was good. The job was easy. Those who were above me gave me the time I needed to travel and perform. But on the other hand I didn’t sleep much, there was shows I had to turn down because I couldn’t get that particular day off or I didn’t know ahead of time and I had to decline. Now I don’t have Whole Foods in my way of my true passion. It’s bittersweet because I loved some of the people I worked with. I loved the opportunities the job gave me. I mean I spent 10 yrs of my life working for the company. I only had 2 solid jobs before that. Funny all of those years came to an end because I got caught using my cell phone and was told on. My fault completely. I was trying to manage the many things I do outside of Whole Foods while working at Whole Foods. It caught up to me. So they fired me. The sweet side is, I got what I wanted. God has given me the opportunity to pursue something fully that I was halfway pursuing. I’m sitting here today a full time Artist/Publisher, self employed, no money, but I’m happy. I finally feel free. I can’t lie and say I’m not a bit nervous for this new stage in my life. I can’t lie and say this will be easy. But I can say I’m going to do my best. I’ve failed myself. I’ve let myself down. I was on such a roll and lost balance. Now I have no choice but to maintain my focus and work harder than ever before. But I can’t do this alone. I need my family more than ever. I need my friends more than ever. All of my fans I need YOU more than ever. My art will literally keep me fed and put a roof over my head. Without your help I’m not sure where I will be. All I ask is that you support me and trust that I will give you my best. Purchase my books/CDs, visit my website sexwithmynotebook.com, tell your friends about me, and be looking forward to what I have coming in the future. This is my life. I welcome everyone to take this journey with me.

Peace,

story:
Hello all you beautiful beings of light and love!

I was suggested by a really good friend of mine to create this Indiegogo and help pave the way to my magical experience on the playa for the first time ever.

This year I was granted a low income ticket, and even with that AMAZING help and opportunity, I am not working enough to translate my income into the de-virginizing journey into the desert this year.

 

This is where you can help! I totally understand it's a difficult task to just give away money, and I know, who is really deserving of free money? I certainly don't think I am.

BUT it would mean the world to me if anyone of you could aid me in this situation. I thought I was going to be financially stable this far out after graduation but it appears that is not the case. A couple situations occured and more money was needed than originally planned. On top of that I am still waiting on money owed to me. SO, this leaves me short for the cause.

 

If there is any amount of money you want to drop into the Get-Ryan-to-the-Playa fund this is the place to do so. I don't expect to reach the (minimum allowed) goal of $500 but if that does happen, then my entire trip should be fully funded by the love of my friends and family!

 

After the cost of the ticket, this Indiegogo will cover my other expenses for the trip as well! I will be staying in The Neighborhood camp that my friends created and are located at 8 & Extraterrestrial. To help with their camp they require funding as well and so if you stay there, you pay a fee. It covers essentials and allows more fun in the sun.

 

 

 

So in conclusion, I love you, and if you can help me with this incredibly magical experience I will find a way to repay you somehow. Whether it be in love, gifts, handmades, hugs, dancing, spirit, good vibes, or anything to push the positive vibrational envelope!

Peace Love Light Ding Swiss <3

CPT represent. CPT life.

story:
Why Should You Support GtB?

Since GtB started in 2007, it has existed purely as a volunteer-run operation created to raise environmental awareness through hosting art and creative community activities.

Our growth and development over the last 6 years has expanded our vision of community service in Beijing and throughout China. Our ultimate aim is to enrich and strengthen the ties between a diverse cross-section of green thinkers and doers, nationwide and around the globe!

Currently we are seeking funds to continue doing what we do and to do it well. All of the money raised through this platform will go towards the following:

GtB ONLINE
Our website (under development) is a public tool to post news, information, events, artwork, and even job listings focused on green life in China. Slowly but surely we are building our online community, with the plan to maintain a lively interactive green community space on the web. 

GtB ANNUAL EVENTS
Greening the Beige hosts activies throughout the year that connect innovative “green” artists, musicians, filmmakers, designers, experts, researchers, and entrepreneurs based in Beijing.

GtB FUND FOR THE GREEN ARTS
Launching in 2013, this fund is designed to celebrate, discover, and reward Chinese artists, photographers, and writers that submit exemplary public works dedicated to raising environmental awareness.

GtB ECO-AiR @ 943 Studio
Premiering at the end of this year, the ECO-AiR program at 943 Studio in Kunming, Yunnan Province, will host and facilitate international artists that work on local eco-art projects in China's most bio-diverse region for 2 months.

The Impact

GtB is a non-profit volunteer organization that relies solely on the kindness of its green-hearted contributors. By supporting this campaign, you are helping to increase...

  • Creative ideas and solutions for environmental problems
  • Public information and interaction around the world
  • Youth awareness and ecological advocacy in Beijing
  • Environmentally conscious art projects throughout China

What We Need & What You Get

GtB will lavish every ultra-generous contributor to this fund in a myriad of creative ways. Please see the list of rewards on the right --->

Plan A - Total funds needed:

  • GtB Online - $300
  • GtB Annual Events - $500
  • GtB Fund for the Green Arts (seed for 2014) - $800
  • GtB Eco-AiR @ 943 Studio - $3,200
  • (the remaining $200 will help us cover fees from Indie Gogo*)

*If we raise our total goal of $5,000 we will need to pay 4% to Indiegogo. Otherwise, we will need to pay 9% of whatever we do raise.

Plan B - Use of funds raised below $5,000:

GtB Online - 6%

GtB Annual Events - 10%

GtB Fund for the Green Arts (seed for 2014) - 15%

GtB Eco-AiR @ 943 Studio - 60%

* Indie Gogo Fee - 9%

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate money right now, but still want to help, we'd love to have your support in any of the following ways listed below:
  1. Help promote our campaign through your personal networks/favorite social media sites.
  2. Post a glowing recommendation or word of support on our campaign wall here!
  3. Volunteer with us this year and get in touch: http://www.greeningthebeige.org/gtb/contact

story:
The LED Zeppelin Needs Your HELP!

The LED Zeppelin made its first appearance out on the playa last year and provided entertainment for many.  For those that don't know of it here's a brief:

The Zeppelin is built on an electric vehicle platform composed of a 3hp electric motor and deep cycle batteries.  Angelo Figallo and I radically modified it into a large 14 person Zeppelin with 960 high-lumens LED lamps.  The lamps are controlled by an array of solid state relays and on-board computer system that synchronize to music.

Video and photos of the LED Zeppelin here:

Photos http://www.flickr.com/photos/82332540@N02/sets/...

Videos http://www.flickr.com/photos/82332540@N02/sets/...

 

The Problem and The Resolution

Despite efforts to recondition the power system on the vehicle we have been met with problems.  The current battery system is depleted and has also caused irreversable corrosion on the primary power wires.  The system needs a total of 18 new 6v deep cycle batteries to move and they are not cheap!  Your donations go towards the purchase of new batteries and wiring!

  • Donate!  Get a LED Zeppelin t-shirt or more!
  • If we aren't able to get within a few hundred of the goal the funds still go to a good cause, the Marin Humane Society as an anonymous donation!

Contribute to Burning Man Art

Burning Man is an experience that is made by the people.  Without artist, musicians, actors, and other creativity the event would not exist.

This is the 2nd Mutant Vehicle over the course of 9 years I have brought to the playa.  They take an incredible amount of effort, resources, ingenuity, and HELP to build.  Any contributions bring this closer to lighting up the playa and putting wows on people's faces!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute you can still help the following ways:

  • Upvote me on reddit here!  http://www.reddit.com/r/BurningMan/comments/wd2...
  • Repost this link to your Burning Man affiliated email list of choice or local art community group.
  • Spread the word via Twitter, Facebook, Path, or other social media!

If we aren't able to get within a few hundred of the goal the funds still go to a good cause, the Marin Humane Society as an anonymous donation!



Contribute to Burning Man Art
Burning Man is an experience that is made by the people.  Without artist, musicians, actors, and other creativity the event would not exist.
This is the 2nd Mutant Vehicle over the course of 9 years I have brought to the playa.  They take an incredible amount of effort, resources, ingenuity, and HELP to build.  Any contributions bring this closer to lighting up the playa and putting wows on people's faces!


Other Ways You Can Help
If you're unable to contribute you can still help the following ways:


Upvote me on reddit here!  http://www.reddit.com/r/BurningMan/comments/wd2...

Repost this link to your Burning Man affiliated email list of choice or local art community group.
Spread the word via Twitter, Facebook, Path, or other social media!

story:
Hi and thanks for looking at our project.  Here at Focusworks we create amazing spinning art.  We made our first top in August 2015 to demonstrate our equipment to high-school students invited to our shop for a tour, and to show them that manufacturing is fun. I put the first couple of designs on our Etsy store to see what would happen, not realising that tops were popular.  Turns out that they are!  Now we have a website as well and run a popular Facebook group.  Please come and join to stay up to date on everything we're working on.

This of course has led to a passion for spinning tops with the designs getting more and more intricate and interesting.  For your enjoyment and relaxation here is Link!

Where did the concept come from?

In late 2015 I had an idea to design a puzzle themed top.  We threw some concepts around here at the shop but nothing made sense to build.  It was either too complicated or simply unfeasible.  Fast forward to early 2018, the concept never left me.  I was looking at another design that I've been dying to make but it has an open rim and I'd done three tops in a row with open rims and I wanted to make one with a closed rim this time.  That's when inspiration hit!  I made a few modifications (lots of them really) to that design and arrived with Link.  (That other design is called Atlantis and I'm still dying to make it, keep an eye out in the Facebook group for it.) 

 

What are the perks?

Link is a three piece top consisting of a lower rotor, upper rotor and stem.  That is the order that the materials are listed in.  We've been busy experimenting with different finish options and our two latest are exciting.  Magma, which is a finish that we've developed for copper and Black Magma, our newest, is a black finish on bronze.  All Link's will come with a 1/8" tungsten carbide contact point and a certificate of authenticity.  Link is 1.24" diameter and weighs approximately 37 grams.  Spin time's are over 5 minutes.  I'm the worlds slowest spinner so I would expect this top to get over 7 minutes by someone who spins faster than me.  Check out the different material combinations below.  

A word about the top's

We love flame blued tops however bluing is an art and every blued top will be unique showing some variations in color.

Magma is a finish we developed for copper and it will tarnish where it gets touched.  We apply an anti tarnish treatment to it at the shop and include care instructions in the box with it.

Black Magma is a finish we developed for bronze.  It's very new but testing that we've done has shown it to be quite tough.  Oils from your fingers darken it and a coat of Renaissance wax will protect it and make it nearly black.

We use every high and low tech technique at the Focusworks shop to ensure that we make the best product possible.  However, due to the amount of machining and inconsistencies in the raw material some flutter while spinning is possible.  We will not refund or replace your top due to flutter.

Who am I?

My name is Jordy Wallace and I own and operate a CNC machine shop in Sechelt, British Columbia, Canada.  That's on the west coast near the city of Vancouver.  My business is Focus Machining & Design and I work in the EDC world as FocusWorks.  I've been in business since 2010.  When I'm not making top's and fidget spinners my clients have me design and build electric bikes, yacht parts, and high end audio parts among other things.  It's interesting work.  I do all of the machine programming and run the day to day of the business.  My wife Lisa Wallace does all of the shipping, book-keeping and is learning to be a machinist.  She's also a welder.  I also have an apprentice, Torvan, who is learning to be a machinist.  I hope you'll take a minute to support our business.  Thanks for looking.

story:
WHY A CAMPAIGN

I am married to my high school sweetheart, Andrew, and we have been together for 12 years. After a few years of being unsuccessful in naturally expanding our family, we are so excited to announce that WE ARE ADOPTING! We are eager to be parents but the adoption process can be quite long, unpredictable, and expensive. The idea to crowdfund with my artwork in an effort to raise funds for our infant adoption came to me early on. I have been working hard the last few months to crank out a new body of work just for this campaign.

To my surprise, my idea of home has changed drastically for me and I am excited to see how this will reflect in my artmaking. Our home will feel empty until we are matched with Baby Temple and this inspired me to create my "There’s No Place Like Home" campaign.

 

ABOUT THE ARTWORK

All of the paintings in this campaign are original and most are made specifically for this campaign. Since we currently have an 'empty nest' I began a new series of work inspired by 'empty homes' located in Omaha, Nebraska. ‘Empty’ makes reference to homes that are not currently occupied. They may be between renters, on the market to sell, foreclosed by the bank, or just abandoned. As an artist, I am engaged with expressing ‘home’ as a physical structure and vessel that holds us as humans. 

All of the perks I am offering are original paintings in a variety of sizes. In my artistic process, I paint and draw on watercolor paper and once I feel the piece is almost complete, I adhere the paper onto 1.5” depth wood panels. I add some final touches, like painting the sides of the piece, and then attach hanging hardware on the back.

 

THE IMPACT

The entire adoption process can cost upwards of $40,000 depending on: what the birthmother’s medical needs are, agency starter costs, state-mandated education/homestudy, fingerprinting/background checks, and travel costs to pick up Baby Temple (our agency is out of state). There can also be additional medical/travel costs if the infant has to stay in the hospital longer than expected due to an early birth, Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome, or unresolved paperwork. 100% of the funds raised will be put towards our infant adoption.

 

HOW IT WORKS

Step 1: Select the painting size you would like on the right hand side of the campaign page and follow the steps to donate funds.

Step 2: Wait anxiously and excitedly to "adopt" a painting of mine as I personally select your piece and prepare for a stork drop!

Step 3: Receive your new "bundle of joy" via mail or drop-off(local to Omaha only).

 

THANK YOU!

Please spread the word with friends, family, and co-workers that you think may like my work, especially on your social media platforms! My husband and I want you to know that we are grateful for everyone who is supporting us in any way. Thank you for being a part of our beautiful journey of adoption!

story:
Finding the extraordinary in the ordinary, and raising it up, is my longstanding endeavor as a singer and songwriter.

Just because it seemed fun, I started taking photos with my iPhone and writing haiku.   People started asking for a BOOK!   I took the plunge, and here we are: 'Haiku Milieu: photo and haiku for you, everywhere you are,' is a collection of 120 full color photos and haiku to connect you with the extraordinary all around us.  It is ready, willing and able to join your library, or be given as a gift, this holiday Season.

'Haiku Milieu: A Musical Companion' features remixes of my songs by Mikhail Fiksel, aka DJ White Russian, to play while you are reading the book, at holiday gatherings, or in the background of daily life.   My signature creamy soft t-shirts complete the Haiku Milieu sensory experience.  

I am doing an Indiegogo pre-sale campaign so that I can offer the book at $25, a price that simply covers the costs of production.  In January, when it becomes available on Amazon and other online retailers, the cost of the book goes up to $35 to cover production AND distribution costs.  So, for the price you'd pay to just purchase the book on Amazon, right now, you can get the book AND the CD!

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Erik-James, a 20-something gay trans man, based in London.
  • I would love to have a brand of my own, a dream I've long desired but thought unreasonable. I realised that it's important to work for what you want so I now intend to take those steps.
  • I want to make items for people like me - queers, misfits, freaks, underdogs.
  • Without your contributions, no matter how seemingly small, this pipedream would not be possible.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I want to start my store with five designs. This works out perfectly as IndieGoGo requires a minimum of £500 to be earned per campaign, and this would cover those five designs.
  • There are many different perks for all price brackets; from the reasonable, to the ludicrous. 
  • The £500 will go, in its entirity, towards covering the costs of production.

The Impact

  • Without your contribution, this cannot go ahead. I do not at present have enough funds to cover the costs without assistance. I am relying on friends, family, and their generosity. 
  • After the initial costs have been covered, the brand should become self-sufficient, I hope to branch out to clothing, tote bags, patches, etc but firstly wish to start small.

Risks & Challenges

  • There is a likelihood that I will not hit £500, but I intend to at least try. 
  • Should I not reach my goal, I will keep the money raised aside and work to hit my funding goal until the cash is rasied, by whatever means.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that a lot of us are under financial strains, and am sympathetic to that. If you were able to help me in other ways, I would be just as grateful.

  • Sharing my campaign with your friends and families.
  • Sharing this idea within the queer communites you inhabit. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and I truly hope you can be a part of Abprallen!
